= Contacts_helpdesk

== Requirements

* Redmine 1.2.1+
* Redmine Contacts CRM plugin 2.2.0+ pro or light version installed
* MySQL, PostgerSQL or SQLite
* Required installed gem or plugin acts-as-taggable-on

== Installation

* Unarchive plugin to redmine/vendor/plugins
* rake db:migrate_plugins RAILS_ENV=production

== Uninstallation

* rake db:migrate:plugin NAME=redmine_contacts_helpdesk VERSION=0 RAILS_ENV=production 
* rm -rf vendor/plugins/redmine_contacts_helpdesk

== Setup

=== Params

* project - redmine project identifier, required
* reopen_status - status name for issues. When answer received from customer status changes to that
* assigned_to - assignee user login
* tracker - tracker name for created issue (Bug, Feature, Support and etc.)

=== Gmail IMAP example

rake redmine:email:contacts_helpdesk:receive_imap RAILS_ENV="production" host=imap.gmail.com username=gmail_address@gmail.com password=your_password port=993 ssl=1 project=support reopen_status=In progress assigned_to=user_login

=== Add to cron in Linux

sudo crontab -e
add such line for every 10 minutes updates:
*/10 * * * * rake -f /redmine/install/folder/Rakefile redmine:email:contacts_helpdesk:receive_imap RAILS_ENV="production" host=imap.gmail.com username=******@gmail.com password=****** port=993 ssl=1 project=support reopen_status=In progress assigned_to=user_login

or this line if all mail server settings stored in project
*/10 * * * * rake -f /redmine/install/folder/Rakefile redmine:email:contacts_helpdesk:receive RAILS_ENV="production"

== Test

rake db:drop RAILS_ENV=test && rake db:migrate db:migrate_plugins RAILS_ENV=test && rake test:plugins PLUGIN=redmine_contacts_helpdesk RAILS_ENV=test
